metadata.note: Cross-market relative valuation comparisons for JP-US company pairs. PER values are approximate trailing/forward blended estimates.

comparison.valuation_thesis: TEL trades at premium reflecting Japan semi equipment scarcity value and TSMC Kumamoto catalyst. LRCX offers better value on pure fundamentals. TEL has broader process coverage (coater/developer monopoly); LRCX dominates etch.
comparison.convergence_catalyst: TSMC Japan expansion announcements could further widen premium; US semi slowdown could narrow it.
comparison.recommendation: TEL premium justified by domestic catalyst but watch for mean reversion if TSMC capex decelerates

comparison.valuation_thesis: MHI premium reflects Japan defense spending inflection (1% to 2% GDP) repricing. RTX is mature defense prime at steady-state. MHI has higher growth trajectory but lower margins. Market pricing in Japan defense structural shift.
comparison.convergence_catalyst: Japan FY2027 defense budget confirmation could sustain premium. Any GCAP delays or budget shortfall would compress valuation.
comparison.recommendation: MHI premium is stretched vs RTX on fundamentals but justified if 2% GDP defense target is maintained

comparison.valuation_thesis: Fanuc premium reflects global robotics leadership (CNC + robot) and humanoid robotics optionality. ROK is US-centric PLC/automation play in cyclical trough. Fanuc has superior IP moat (servo, CNC, robots) vs ROK (software/PLC).
comparison.convergence_catalyst: China factory automation recovery lifts Fanuc more. US reshoring capex cycle favors ROK. Humanoid robotics announcements could widen Fanuc premium.
comparison.recommendation: ROK offers better near-term value at cyclical bottom; Fanuc has superior structural positioning and humanoid upside

comparison.valuation_thesis: Massive valuation gap reflects US cybersecurity premium pricing (pure-play, platform model) vs NEC as diversified IT conglomerate. NEC cybersecurity is embedded within broader IT services. PANW has superior growth, margins, and SaaS economics.
comparison.convergence_catalyst: Japan Active Cyber Defense law could lift NEC cybersecurity segment valuation. NEC spin-off or segment disclosure could narrow gap. PANW growth deceleration narrows from other side.
comparison.recommendation: NEC is deep value if Japan cybersecurity policy accelerates; PANW is quality premium worth paying for pure-play exposure

comparison.valuation_thesis: GEV premium reflects pure-play grid/power narrative post-GE spin-off. Hitachi Energy is comparable but embedded in diversified conglomerate. Both face same global transformer shortage tailwind. GEV benefits from US IRA grid spending.
comparison.convergence_catalyst: Hitachi Energy segment reporting improvement could narrow discount. Global transformer shortage worsening benefits both equally. GEV margin expansion could widen gap.
comparison.recommendation: Hitachi offers better value with diversification benefit; GEV is pure-play premium for grid/energy transition exposure

comparison.valuation_thesis: TOWA trades at significant premium to NVDA on PER, reflecting small-cap HBM packaging niche monopoly (80%+ compression mold share). NVDA is cheaper on PER due to massive earnings power. TOWA is a leveraged play on NVDA's AI GPU demand via HBM supply chain.
comparison.convergence_catalyst: Any HBM demand slowdown would compress TOWA premium sharply. NVDA Blackwell/Rubin ramp sustains TOWA order book. TOWA capacity expansion announcements are key.
comparison.recommendation: TOWA is high-conviction leveraged NVDA play but premium is vulnerable to HBM cycle deceleration

comparison.valuation_thesis: BWXT premium reflects sole-source naval nuclear monopoly and US defense spending visibility. JSW has nuclear pressure vessel capability but is more diversified (plastics machinery, steel products). BWXT has $7.4B backlog providing multi-year earnings visibility. JSW is a value play on nuclear renaissance.
comparison.convergence_catalyst: SMR commercialization could lift JSW if it wins component orders. Japan nuclear restart acceleration helps JSW. BWXT premium could compress if SMR timeline extends.
comparison.recommendation: BWXT is premium-quality nuclear monopoly; JSW offers value entry to nuclear renaissance theme at 33% discount

comparison.valuation_thesis: Massive discount reflects TEPCO Fukushima legacy overhang, regulatory uncertainty, and Kashiwazaki-Kariwa restart risk. CEG premium from Microsoft nuclear PPA and clean nuclear fleet. TEPCO has 7.0GW Kashiwazaki-Kariwa capacity (largest nuclear plant globally) as dormant asset. If restart succeeds, revaluation potential is enormous.
comparison.convergence_catalyst: Kashiwazaki-Kariwa restart approval would be transformative for TEPCO. Hyperscaler nuclear PPA deals in Japan would validate CEG-like repricing. Fukushima decommissioning cost increases could widen gap.
comparison.recommendation: TEPCO is highest asymmetry nuclear play globally - 60% PER discount to CEG with 7.0GW restart optionality, but binary risk
